actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Resolution Agreed to in House (Amended) by Voice Vote.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the furnishing of assistance for the Republic of Liberia, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that: (1) the October 15, 1985, election in the Republic of Liberia does not meet specified requirements of the International Security and Development Cooperation Act of 1985; (2) the President should disburse economic support fund assistance to Liberia when the Government of Liberia has instituted specified changes; and (3) the President should suspend military assistance to Liberia unless that country releases all political prisoners and provides for free elections. Defines "political prisoner" for purposes of this Resolution. Declares that the House of Representatives expresses U.S. friendship to the people of Liberia and the desire of the United States for the establishment of democracy in that country.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the furnishing of assistance for the Republic of Liberia, and for other purposes.
